chapter.title: The PLplot X Driver Family
chapter.para: There are several drivers for working with the MIT X Windows system. Beginning with PLplot 5.0, the following drivers are supported.

sect1.title: The Xwin Driver
sect1.para: The Xwin driver draws plots in an X-window using Xlib. The raster output is rather coarse, but renders very fast. The Xwin driver is excellent for quick-look plots, and is the reference driver for plplot. However, it should be noted that the Xwin driver is not unicode-enabled.
The Xwin driver displays plots one page at a time. The pager is advanced by pressing the Enter key.

sect1.title: The GCW Driver
sect1.para: The GCW (Gnome Canvas Widget) driver produces high-quality output in a Gnome window, but renders slower than the Xwin driver. The GCW driver can also be used to embed plots in Gnome applications, and this is described in the section on Embedding Plots in Gnome Applications. The GCW driver is unicode enabled.

Plots are presented in separate tabs. There are a variety of hot keys that may be used:
Arrows : Change page
+ : Zooms in
- : Zooms out
= : Zooms to 100%
q : Quits

sect1.title: The Tk Driver
sect1.para: is the prototype of a whole new interaction paradigm. See next chapter.

chapter.title: The PLplot Output Driver Family
chapter.para: There are several drivers which produce output files to be displayed by another system. Beginning with PLplot 5.0, the following drivers are supported.

sect1.title: The Postscript Driver
sect1.para: The Postscript driver produces publication-quality postscript output. This driver is unicode enabled.

sect1.title: The GD Driver
sect1.para: The GD driver is used to produce high-quality png, jpeg, and gif images, using devices by the same name. All of the GD devices are unicode enabled.
